title: Changes to roster status logic on Trades
custom_steps:
**AC**

- If the player is a Major League Player, then when updating the player's Pending or Current roster status for a Trade or PTBNL (see stories #129462741, #129463383 and #129474671), use the updated logic

- In-season:  
Active and DFA roster statuses becomes Not Yet Reported
All other roster statuses including DL and IL should remain unchanged
Optioned players continue  to have their pending MN roster status set to Null (until the Recall is created)

- Off-season: 
 Active and DFA become Active
All other roster statuses including DL and IL should remain unchanged
Optioned players continue  to have their pending MN roster status set to Null (until the Recall is auto-created)

title: As a club, I want to know when a player has earned a contingency bonus
custom_steps:
**Wireframe**
http://f2j41d.axshare.com/#p=bonus_payment_tracker

**AC**

General Batch AC
- This is calculated as a Nightly batch called "Contingency Bonus batch"
- It can be run in Report and Update mode on demand via the Batches interface
- It can also be run on an individual player ID
- Results are returned with each player that the batch as marked as having earned the bonus (can be negotiated)
- All other global batch requirements are consistent with other batches

Batch Activity
- Find all players who have a potential Contingency Bonus, or 'earned but not paid' Contingency bonus (date paid should not be entered)
- For each player, verify if player has the required number of "Active" days at the respective level of play. Only active roster status counts and only service earned in the first year on the contract counts
- If yes, then set the Payment due date of that player's bonus to the date that player will reach the required days. This should show on Payment tracker
- If no, then verify if the player is selected under Rule 5 before the bonus becomes payable. In this case the bonus is due immediately by the club in the date when the contract was selected.
- If the payment due date is set, then update the status of that payment to "Earned, Not Paid"
- Contingency Bonuses may only be earned in the Contract Start Year. If it is past the start year, set the status of any Potential Con Bonuses to "Cancelled"
- When viewing in the payment tracker, If a CON bonus is potential, and the player is traded, the Responsible Org for the bonus should be the new club of the player.
- If the CON bonus is Expired, Earned, or Paid, the Org should be locked to the Org under which he earned it with

title: As a club, I want to revert a payment to unpaid on the tracker
custom_steps:
**AC**
- Clubs can edit the payment tracker and blank out the paid date and Save. 
- On Save, the status of that bonus should revert to "Earned, not paid"

Other Miscellaneous changes
- The totals at the bottom of the tracker should show the total amounts of the filtered values. Changing the filters should update the total. Also change the label to "Total" instead of "Total Due"
- Clubs can navigate to other club's payment tracker using the Org toggle. However, they should only have edit permissions to their own club
- Change default filter to Status = earned not paid

custom_steps:

- Front end rule 1.06 - #126081031
- Onsubmit rule 2.16 - #126430817
- Trade checklist item - #129475125

title: As a club, I want to be stopped if I don't pay the minimum ML salary for players with ML service - INC0063586
custom_steps:
**AC**
Bus rule 19.131
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-BR-403+19.+Add+C+onSubmit+Rules

- On both MNCs and Add Cs, run the following rule check:
- Rule: If the player has a Major League Contract that is Active AND he has at least 1 or more days of Major league service, then his Salary cannot be lower than Minimum Minor League Salary system value.
- If rule fails, show Hard error to Club and Override for BOC
- Error message: [Player name] salary may not be lower than Minimum Minor League Salary rate $[amount]

QA - Please verify on both Contracts and Addendum Cs.

title: As a club, I want to track CEP payments and balances on the payment tracker
custom_steps:
**AC**
- On the Payment tracker, show all CEP invoice payments (similar to story #142359527)
- If the payment has been made and date paid is available, status is "paid". Else, status is Earned not Paid.
- Type is "CEP-INV"

- On the payment tracker show all potential CEP balance payments owed to players.  (Similar to #142359229)
- For CEP, Living allowance is shown as a lump sum as opposed to a Pay Per Period (only difference from CSP)
- Status of these payments is 'Potential'
- Type is "CEP-Tuition Allowance" or "CEP-Living Allowance"
- Date paid is set to "Exp [Date]" for Living Allowance rows

- All other columns are populated as normal
- No fields are editable for these rows for any user type
- Add 'CEP Invoice' and 'CEP Balance' options to the Type filter
- Date on the tracker must match the CEP details on the Player profile

title: Detect if an uploaded PDF is invalid before the contract stamping process is attempted
custom_steps:
We need to programmatically detect when a PDF cannot be stamped - and warn a user that there is an issue.  The PDF that triggered this story can be opened in most PDF tools, but does not allow our PDF libraries (currently itext) to manipulate/stamp the PDF.  Also need to research when this occurs - look at the club in question and review their process.

Tied to jira EBISII-12417 - an example of the bad PDF is attached to the jira

Model this after what MJC does - make it a state change rule saying that an attachment is not stampable.  Look at MjcBusinessRules.checkContractAttachmentCanBeStamped
